docs.title: Kubernetes Networking Deep Dive
docs.text: Kubernetes networking is critical for SREs and system administrators. Pods must communicate with each other and with services, often across nodes.

docs.title: Kubernetes Networking Model
docs.text: Kubernetes uses a flat network model. Every Pod gets its own IP and can talk to other Pods directly.

docs.title: CNI (Container Network Interface)
docs.text:
CNI is the standard interface for networking in Kubernetes. Popular plugins: Cilium, Calico.

kubectl apply -f cni-config.yaml

docs.title: Example: Create a Pod
docs.text:
kubectl run nginx --image=nginx --restart=Never
kubectl get pods

Use kubectl describe pod nginx to inspect networking details.

docs.title: Kubernetes Overview
docs.text: Learn about pods, deployments, services, and ConfigMaps.

docs.title: Example: Create a Pod
docs.text:
Run a simple Nginx pod:

kubectl run nginx --image=nginx --restart=Never
kubectl get pods

docs.title: Kubernetes ConfigMaps
docs.text:
Example usage of ConfigMaps

kubectl create configmap my-config --from-file=config.yaml

docs.title: Kubernetes Deployments
docs.text:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: nginx-deployment
spec:
  replicas: 3
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: nginx
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: nginx
    spec:
      containers:
      - name: nginx
        image: nginx:latest

docs.title: Kubernetes Service Example
docs.text:
kubectl expose pod nginx --type=NodePort --port=80
kubectl get svc
